Detailed positions contains bought/sold information and profit/loss information - realized for closed positions, theoretical per open ones.

member.name: T:OEC.API.Bases.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace contains base types of API objects and containers.
See for API overview

member.name: T:OEC.API.Command
member.summary: Order command: one of create, modify and cancel command of an
member.remarks:
During the lifetime of order, user can control it by sending commands.
Create command is associated with initial of order and created when client sends a new order.
Modify command also have new version of order, but cancel command does not.
When command is sent to server, it has state. The state then could be changed to , meaning that command was failed by the reason found in property, or to - meaning that command succeed. in both cases, property will updated with execution/failure timestamp.
When cancel command succeed, order becomes or - depending of number of active fills.
If the modify command succeeds, current order version is replaced, and variable order properties, such as quantity or price will be updated.

member.name: T:OEC.API.OECClient
member.summary: This class represents a client connection to the OEC Server and provides access to all API data and functionality.
member.remarks:
Principles of work The OECClient component serves as a gateway to the OEC Server, sending client requests and receiving server responses over the internet. Client session data are represented in form of objects tree available as OECClient instance properties: OECClient. is an collection of orders, for example. See "Data model" section below for details
Client requests are sent by calling component methods, such as , and any changes or additions to session data are visible to client as events (like )
Network transmission is asynchronous (performed in background), so all method calls do not return immediate results - in most cases client should wait for appropriate event to make sure that requested action succeeded (or failed).
Data Model Primary object of OEC Data model is an . This object contains all information about order lifetime, such as , and history, and order s - remained or canceled. OEC API loads all orders from current trading session on login.
Accounting information can be accessed by objects. There are open/closed statistics and account cash (or several balances for different currencies, if any).
Trading environment objects, such as contracts, currencies, exchanges provided easy access to fundamental data. Some additional object types, like s and s were introduced to maintain structured access.
Dynamic data like currency conversion rate, contract last price and depth of market updates are stored in corresponding objects - i.e. and . Theoretical profit/loss for open positions is updated in real-time, when the price feed is available for given contract.
All objects can be found in their respective collections by ID or name, or retrieved from another object properties - for example, an order contains references to its account and contract.
Note that any date/time values provided by API are in UTC time zone, except the opening/closing times for contracts - which are local to contract exchange.
Getting started To use the OEC system, first thing that client needs to do is to connect to the OEC Server:
OECClient1.Connect(oechost, oecport, "username", "password", false);
After that, client application should need to wait for one of events: or
In cause of successful login, all collections is already populated with session data (order states and fills, account positions), so application could display it on the GUI. If by some reason connection is dropped, event would be fired immediately, notifying the client that requests couldn't be processed until connection is restored.
On a successful login system is ready to process client requests: subscriptions to price feeds and order requests.

member.name: P:OEC.API.OECClient.UUID
member.summary: Unique Universal IDentifier (UUID) This value has to be set to identify application when OEC API is being used by 3rd parties. Remoting connections are required to specify UUID as well. UUID must be obtained from OEC by contacting support (GFSupport@gaincapital.com). Obtaining the UUID and connecting your application to OEC with the UUID will enable your users to leverage a single login to access both your application as well as OEC's Trading platform at the same time.

member.remarks: Note that all objects will still be available for viewing after disconnect, but no order operations or subscriptions could be performed.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.SendOCOOrders(OEC.API.OrderDraft[])
member.summary: Sends a group of orders as OCO - One cancels other
member.remarks: OCO orders sends as a group of mutually exclusive orders - when one order is executed (filled), others are canceled.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.SendLinkedOrders(OEC.API.OrderDraft,OEC.API.OrderDraft[])
member.remarks:
- when main order is filled, linked orders are activated as OCO orders
To specify grouping method, use the overload method
To make the linked orders depend on the main order's price use and . If grouping method is unspecified this will have no effect.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.SendLinkedOrders(OEC.API.OrderDraft,OEC.Data.OSOGroupingMethod,OEC.API.OrderDraft[])
member.remarks:
- when main order is filled, linked orders are activated as OCO orders
To set a price dependence of the linked orders from the main order user and
member.param: Defines how linked orders are grouped

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.SendOrder(OEC.API.OrderDraft,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal, sends an with forced route.
member.remarks: Intended for administrative use, trader's orders could be rejected.
member.param: if true, order will be sent to pit, regardless of contract type

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.SendOrder(OEC.API.OrderDraft)
member.summary: Sends a new with parameters supplied by instance.
member.remarks: Order draft could be created using call. The order will receive event, meaning that server successfully receives the order and assigns a ticket number to it. Then clint should monitor event and/or check when order was accepted or rejected, become working and completed. to watch how order is filled client need to listen to .

member.name: P:OEC.API.OECClient.WashAccounts
member.remarks:

member.param: Flag indicating the created order is added to the Orders list.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.ModifyOrder(OEC.API.OrderDraft)
member.remarks:
New order version is taked from created from this order by call. The modification will be put in the list and new order will be placed to the list.
Note that the modification command will be initially in pending state, and the client should monitor event and/or to see whether the command was executed or failed.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CancelOrder(OEC.API.Order)
member.summary: Sends cancel request for an existing .
member.remarks: Cancel will be added to the list. Note that the cancel command will be initially in pending state, and the client should monitor event and/or to see whether the command was executed or failed. Also order will become when cancel command succeed.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CancelOrder(OEC.API.Order,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends cancel request for an existing .
member.remarks: Cancel will be added to the list. Note that the cancel command will be initially in pending state, and the client should monitor event and/or to see whether the command was executed or failed. Also order will become when cancel command succeed.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.AcceptOrder(OEC.API.Order)

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.RejectOrder(OEC.API.Order,System.String)
member.remarks: Intended for broker interface - will be ignored for trader login. to be accepted should be in state, and become after.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CompleteOrder(OEC.API.Order,System.String)

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.RejectCommand(OEC.API.Command,System.String)

member.summary: Adds a new to a working
member.remarks:
This command is intended for broker interface and will be ignored for trader logins. New fill reports will be added to the list. If operation is failed, fill could be added with cancelled ( = false) or just not be added at all.
createTime.Kind should be DateTimeKind.Utc or it will be converted to UTC

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CancelFill(OEC.API.Fill)
member.remarks: This command is intended for broker interface and will be ignored for trader logins. Fill should becomes cancelled ( = false). As a side effect, becomes working if it was already completed.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CreateDraft
member.remarks: Order draft is a placeholder for order parameters. To send an order, client needs to create an order draft instance, fill its parameters and call method. It could be also stored (for example, as a template order)

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CreateDraft(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new filled from template string.
member.remarks: Order draft can be converted to template string using (string) operator, or template string could be created manually. If any order element cannot be parsed, it will be skipped and parsing continues. If template string couldn't be parsed at all, blank order draft will be returned.

member.name: M:OEC.API.OECClient.CreateDraft(OEC.API.Order)
member.remarks: Client can change only version-related properties (quantity, order type, price(s)) New draft will not allow to change order properties - exception will be raised. The draft need to be passed to the method.

member.name: P:OEC.API.OrderDraft.DeltaTicks
member.summary: The difference between of the linked order and the main order in ticks.
member.remarks:
If a value is null, then is constant and does not depend on the price changes of the main order. Also all sub orders will have the same price.
When value is specified price changes of the main order will affect . Sub orders will have price according to specified in .

member.param: Partial Fill Restriction: order may only be matched in amounts of at least this quantity of CCY1
Reserve Size: only display this amount of CCY1. Upon any partial fill the amount will be replenished up to this amount until the full order quantity is exhausted

Format string
Value Output
G Generic format
S Order side
Q Order quantity
C Order contract

T Order type

member.name: T:OEC.API.Fill
member.remarks:
When order is executed on exchange, it receives one or more fills. Fill contains and of execution. When amount of fills of an order is equal to order total quantity, order can considered as 'Filled'.
However, fill could be cancelled by broker - in this situation flag is set to false, and this fill will not be taken in account in filled quantity and average filled price calculations.
Each fill causes the of order contract to change. Cancelled fills revert position to previous value.
Usually, fills are not changed after order gets state.

member.name: T:OEC.API.Order
member.remarks:
When order is created, its placed to collection with a local ID (always negative). As server receives the order, it confirms it and assigns a global unique order ID, then client is notified by event. At this point, order current state is , it has one in its collection, a create with initial order in and respectively.
Some orders, especially pit or MOO/ MOC ones, could then change their state to - this means that they are not active yet and waiting of activation. MOO/MOC orders
Prior to activation, order can be rejected at different stages by risk system, live broker or electronic execution system. In this case it becomes
When order is accepted by system, broker and/or electronic execution system, it becomes - this means that order is active and could be filled. orders usually get filled and completed in a few milliseconds, if trading session is now active for order . Other orders will wait until order condition is satisfied.
Client can request order cancellation - see , or modification - in this case he needs to create a , change values he wants to modify and call method. Both of these actions creates a , and modification also creates a new order version.
Finally, order becomes or - note, that cancellation of a partially filled order makes the order completed, so client should look at filled quantity instead of order quantity to see whether order was fully completed or not.

member.name: T:OEC.API.DOM
member.summary: Depth of Market data for a . See Contract.DOM.
member.remarks:
For ask and bid sides, there are two arrays with same number of items. First one, named [Ask|Bid]Levels, contains price values of "price ladder". Second, named [Ask|Bid]Sizes, contains volumes per corresponding level.
To control subscription, client should use / methods.

member.name: T:OEC.API.PriceIntern
member.summary: Utility class for formatting and parsing prices
member.remarks:
This class using special notation for price format:
positive values specifies number of digits after decimal point (2 = 0.00)
negative - divisor of fraction (-32 = 1/32)

member.name: T:OEC.API.Version
member.summary: version - contains variable parameters of an order.
member.remarks:
Order can have multiple versions, if it was modified. Initial version of order is associated with create , all others - with their modify commands.
Version of last successful modify command, or initial version is an order current version.
All the variable order properties are retrieved from order current version, so has the same value as Order.Versions..

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.Price
member.remarks: In a linked order if is specified changing this value will have a no effect. Change instead.

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.Price2
member.summary: Current order limit price for STPLMT orders
member.remarks: In a linked order if is specified changing this value will not have a no effect. Change instead.

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.DeltaTicks
member.summary: Defines the difference between of the linked order and the main order in ticks.
member.remarks:
If a value is null is constant and does not depend on the price changes of the main order. Also all sub orders will have the same price.
When value is specified price changes of the main order will affect . Sub orders will have price according to specified in .

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.DeltaTicks2
member.summary: Defines the difference between of the linked order and the main order in ticks.
member.remarks:
If a value is null is constant and does not depend on the price changes of the main order. Also all sub orders will have the same price.
When value is specified price changes of the main order will affect . Sub orders will have price according to specified in .

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.Start

member.name: P:OEC.API.Version.End
